pr_title: Support Charset in Quarkus Config - Use it in Hibernate

timeline.bodyText: Hello @geoand, perhaps this should just be defaulted to UTF-8 to remove the inconsistency of system level defaults? AFAIK, Java (in recent versions) too has started defaulting to UTF-8 for some of its IO APIs to avoid this system level inconsistencies.
timeline.author: jaikiran

replies.bodyText:
I think that's reasonable, but I didn't because I wanted to keep it consistent with the other charset property.
If  @Sanne and @gsmet also think it should be UTF-8, I'll gladly update it.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
My inclination would be to go with UTF-8 by default too.
I don't like the name though because it's not the DDL charset, it's the charset used for schema generation and the import scripts (or database initialization in general).
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a Unable to create Charset from: " + value message? (JVM messages can be very obscure sometimes, not sure about that one)
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: @geoand did you miss that one? Or is it intended you didn't fix it?
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Ah, I missed it! Will fix now
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText:
So isn't it already implemented then? :]
(have a look at the name of the property)
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Oh man... I didn't even see that this was the same property... F**k
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message: Use Charset in HibernateOrmConfig and default to UTF-8
